discussion.content:
Generate an RSA key pair for your router, which automatically enables SSH.

 carter(config)#crypto key generate rsa

comments.content:
Explanation:
http://www.cisco.com/en/US/tech/tk583/tk617/technologies_tech_note09186a00800949e2.shtml 
Generate an RSA key pair for your router, whichautomatically enables SSH.

questions.question_text: Which statement is true when you have generated RSA keys on your Cisco router to prepare for secure device management?

choices.B: The SSH protocol is automatically enabled.
choices.D: All vty ports are automatically enabled for SSH to provide secure management.
choices.A: You must then zeroize the keys to reset secure shell before configuring other parameters.
choices.C: You must then specify the general-purpose key size used for authentication with the crypto key generate rsa general-keys modulus command.

discussion.content:
The answer B is correct.
The password recovery procedure enables anyone with console access, the ability to access the router and its network. The No Service Password-Recovery feature prevents the completion of the Break key sequence and the entering of ROMMON mode during system startups and reloads.
You are not aloud to change to confreg reg and do the password reload, while that is true. The over arching reason for this is because you can not do the break sequence to get into ROMMON mode.

A
The No Service Password-Recovery feature is a security enhancement that prevents anyone with console access from accessing the router configuration and clearing the password. It also prevents anyone from changing the configuration register values and accessing NVRAM.

choices.E: the xmodem privilege EXEC mode command to recover the Cisco IOS image

questions.question_text: What will be disabled as a result of the no service password-recovery command?
Which two next-generation encryption algorithms does Cisco recommend? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Encryption algorithms - AES, 3DES
Cryptographic Algorithms - AES, SHA-384

The PVLAN edge (protected port) is a feature that has only local significance to the switch (unlike Private Vlans), and there is no isolation provided between two protected ports located on different switches. A protected port does not forward any traffic (unicast, multicast, or broadcast) to any other port that is also a protected port in the same switch. Traffic cannot be forwarded between protected ports at L2, all traffic passing between protected ports must be forwarded through a Layer 3 (L3) device.

choices.A: PVLAN Edge can be configured to restrict the number of MAC addresses that appear on a single port.
choices.C: By default, when a port policy error occurs, the switchport shuts down.
choices.B: The switch does not forward any traffic from one protected port to any other protected port.
choices.D: The switch only forwards traffic to ports within the same VLAN Edge.

questions.question_text: Which statement about PVLAN Edge is true?

choices.A: The Cisco IOS interface ACL has an implicit permit-all rule at the end of each interface ACL.
choices.E: The Cisco ASA appliance does not support standard ACL. The Cisco ASA appliance only support extended ACL.
choices.C: The Cisco ASA appliance interface ACL configurations use netmasks instead of wildcard masks.
choices.D: The Cisco ASA appliance interface ACL also applies to traffic directed to the IP addresses of the Cisco ASA appliance interfaces.
choices.B: Cisco IOS supports interface ACL and also global ACL. Global ACL is applied to all interfaces.

questions.question_text: Which option is a key difference between Cisco IOS interface ACL configurations and Cisco ASA appliance interface ACL configurations?

discussion.content:
Correct answer.
When you specify a network mask, the method is different from the Cisco IOS software access-list command. The ASA uses a network mask (for example, 255.255.255.0 for a Class C mask). The Cisco IOS mask uses wildcard bits (for example, 0.0.0.255).
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/security/asa/asa96/configuration/firewall/asa-96-firewall-config/access-acls.html
